metadata.title: CVE-2014-3507 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory leak in d1_both.c in the DTLS implementation in OpenSSL 0.9.8 before0.9.8zb, 1.0.0 before 1.0.0n, and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1i allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via zero-lengthDTLS fragments that trigger improper handling of the return value of acertain insert function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3507` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.1 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu7
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu7').
